project.description:
Preflights the Jenkins environment for:
  • armv6-rpi-linux-gnueabi (Raspberry Pi B ver. 1)
  • armv7-rpi2-linux-gnueabihf (Raspberry Pi B ver. 2)
  • armv8-rpi3-linux-gnueabihf (Raspberry Pi B ver. 3)
Checks things like scripts and compilers.

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: BUILD_ARCH
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: Architecture to build with; determines which toolchain to use, and what strings to look for in the resulting test binary

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash ### RUN A TEST COMPILE GIVEN THE TOOLCHAIN IN ${BUILD_ARCH}
# Not sure why this is here... #if [ -t 1 ]; then # echo "terminal is connected to fh #1" #else # echo "terminal is not connected to fh #1" #fi
### EXPORTS AND SOURCING ### export JENKINS_SCRIPTS="${HOME}/src/jenkins/config.git/scripts" # for common_jenkins_functions export QUIET=0 # source environment variables and updated $PATH script source ${HOME}/.bashrc.d/env_vars_path
### COMMON_JENKINS_FUNCTIONS ### echo "Checking for 'common_jenkins_functions.sh' script" if [ -e ${JENKINS_SCRIPTS}/common_jenkins_functions.sh ]; then # source jenkins common functions source ${JENKINS_SCRIPTS}/common_jenkins_functions.sh else echo "ERROR: common_jenkins_functions.sh not found in ${JENKINS_SCRIPTS}" exit 1 fi
job_step_header "Setting up script exports and sourcing"
### CHECK FOR BUILD_ARCH ### if [ -d "/home/cross/${BUILD_ARCH}" ]; then export CROSS_COMPILER="${BUILD_ARCH}-gcc" else echo "ERROR: can't find compiler that matches BUILD_ARCH!" echo "BUILD_ARCH: ${BUILD_ARCH}" exit 1 fi
# FIXME if we ever try to compile multiple architectures, we # would need code to handle more expected outputs here export EXPECTED_BINARY_FILE_OUTPUT="ELF 32-bit LSB executable, ARM" #elif [ "x${BUILD_ARCH}" = "xppc" ]; then # export CROSS_COMPILER="powerpc-lack-linux-gnu-gcc" # export EXPECTED_BINARY_FILE_OUTPUT="ELF 32-bit MSB executable, PowerPC" #else # echo "ERROR: missing/incorrect BUILD_ARCH specified!" # echo "BUILD_ARCH choices: 'arm' or 'ppc'" # exit 1 #fi
### CROSSTOOL-NG ### echo "Checking for crosstool-ng bashrc script" if [ -e ~/.bashrc.d/crosstool-ng-env ]; then source ~/.bashrc.d/crosstool-ng-env else echo "ERROR: crosstool-ng-env bashrc script not found" exit 1 fi
#echo "==== BEGIN JENKINS RUNTIME ENVIRONMENT ====" # output environment to a log file instead of displaying it set > ${BUILD_TAG}.log #echo "==== END JENKINS RUNTIME ENVIRONMENT ===="
job_step_header "Checking for cross-compile binaries/scripts" EXISTS_CT_NG=$(which ct-ng) check_exit_status $? "Checking for 'ct-ng'" "$EXISTS_CT_NG" EXISTS_GCC=$(which $CROSS_COMPILER) check_exit_status $? "Checking for '$CROSS_COMPILER'" "$EXISTS_GCC"
job_step_header "Compiling test binary with '${CROSS_COMPILER}'" if [ -e $WORKSPACE/test_${BUILD_ARCH} ]; then echo "Removing old test binary 'test_${BUILD_ARCH}'" rm $WORKSPACE/test_${BUILD_ARCH} fi cat <<EO_TEST_FILE > ${WORKSPACE}/test.c #include <stdio.h> int main() { printf("Hello, world!\n"); return 0; } EO_TEST_FILE
job_step_header "WORKSPACE CONTENTS" ls -l
job_step_header "CROSS-COMPILE THE TEST BINARY" $CROSS_COMPILER -o $WORKSPACE/test_${BUILD_ARCH} $WORKSPACE/test.c TEST_BINARY_FILE_OUTPUT=$(file $WORKSPACE/test_${BUILD_ARCH})
job_step_header "CHECKING TEST BINARY" VALID_BINARY=$(echo $TEST_BINARY_FILE_OUTPUT | grep -c "${EXPECTED_BINARY_FILE_OUTPUT}")
if [ $VALID_BINARY -gt 0 ]; then echo "==== Test binary 'test_${BUILD_ARCH}' compiled successfully! ====" echo "==== Test binary file is: ====" echo $TEST_BINARY_FILE_OUTPUT exit 0 else echo "ERROR: test binary file 'test_${BUILD_ARCH}' output did not match expected output" echo "Expected: ${EXPECTED_BINARY_FILE_OUTPUT}" echo "Received: ${TEST_BINARY_FILE_OUTPUT}" exit 1 fi
